title: Flight Centre buries the lead
text:
Sceptics’ fears about Flight Centre’s profits have materialised. Glenn Hunt

Flight Centre shares fell 12 per cent on Wednesday, which must have been perplexing to anyone glancing at but not closely interrogating that day's ASX announcements.

Under a headline announcing "strong growth in online leisure sales" and "likely FY20 trading patterns", it took Skroo Turner's lot a whole two pages to get to the rather pertinent news that 1H20's underlying profit was "below the prior corresponding period".

While the announcement was low on precise numbers (guidance will be provided at the November 7 AGM) it did reveal having paid an extra $4.2 million in wages under a new wage model and a $7 million hit from the collapse of Thomas Cook in the UK.

Mind you, Flight Centre put this down the very end, below such vital information as the 140 per cent growth in total transaction value in the Aunt Betty and BYOjet businesses during the first quarter. Which, judging by the selloff, no one considered all that important.
